channel.title: Just a little Q
channel.description: i was wondering what would i type for the mouse to go to a certian bitmap. would i use sumting like [code]MMouse(Findbmp.....)[/code] sumting like that? any help will be aprishiated(sp?)

item.title: Just a little Q
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Scar should be cool enough to let you do this:
MMouse(FindBitmap(bit, x, y), 1, 1);

That’d be cool And confusing for some.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a little Q
item.dc:creator: @oblivian oblivian
item.description:
@oblivian wrote:

id just go like this in 1 of my scripts its not so detectable

if(findbitmap(ur bitmap name,x,y))then
movemousesmoothex(x,y,10,10,5,10,0)
wait(10+(100)

ya that looks right use that

Read full topic

item.title: Just a little Q
item.dc:creator: @inferno inferno
item.description:
@inferno wrote:

Well if you did use the movemouse and clickmouse you would need to put

if(FindBitmap(Bitmap, X, X))Then begin MoveMouse(X, Y); Wait(200+ Random(100)); ClickMouse(X, Y, True); end;

Because if you didn’t have the begin and end then it would perform the clickmouse command even if it didn’t find the bitmap and click at the previous values of the x and y variables, which you don’t want to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a little Q
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

Negatory.

if(findbitmapin(bitmap,x,y,x1,y1,x2,y2))then movemouse(x,y); clickmouse(x,y,true);

That’s the extremely basic code, which is also extremely detectable in RS. I suggest looking through SRL and finding a mouse procedure to take the place of the last two lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a little Q
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

findbitmap(bitmapname,x,y)
mmouse(x,y)
clickmouse (x,y,true)

is that what you wanted

Read full topic
